clinical_study.brief_title: Biomarkers for Identification of COVID-19 Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Biomarkers Identification for Diagnosis and Treatment of SARS-COV-2 Infection

brief_summary.textblock: Acute lung injury represents the most severe form of the viral infection sustained by coronavirus disease 2019 (Covid-19) also named as SARS-CoV-2, a new virus emerged in December 2019 in Wuhan (China). The diagnosis is clinical and patients develop flu-like syndrome with fever and cough; patients with clinical symptoms can perform a swab test for diagnosis of positivity to Covid-19. Even if diagnosis and treatment are well described, to date, this viral pandemic infection induces an increased mortality in the world. The aim of the present project is to evaluate specific biomarkers that could be used for patient stratification and for tailor therapy in COVID-19 infected patients.

primary_outcome.description: Change in biomarkers (microRNAs, oxidative stress, Neuron-Specific Enolase, IL-2, IL-6, TNF-alfa, leukocytes, subtypes lymphocytes) in covid-19 positive patients vs covid-negative patients
Change in CYP450 expression in covid-19 positive patients that develop adverse drug reactions or drug inefficacy

secondary_outcome.measure: biomarkers expression (microRNAs, oxidative stress, Neuron-Specific Enolase, IL-2, IL-6, TNF-alfa, leukocytes, subtypes lymphocytes) after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in biomarkers in covid-19 patients before and after standard treatment

arm_group.description: all drugs used for standard treatment

intervention.description: Evaluation in biomarkers expression between 2 groups

study_pop.textblock: Patients of both sexes and > 18 years with and without covid-19 infection that came in hospital for flu-like syptoms: cough fever and dyspnea

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged between 18 and 75 years, extremes included, male or female In conscious patients, ability to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed consent document; in unconscious patients informed consent will be signed from parents or legal tutors.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that don't sign the informed consent
